intro: Dunbaria barbata, commonly known as the hairy spurflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spurs on the petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Dunbaria barbata is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
